channel.title: [Delta] Yell titles

item.title: [Delta] Yell titles
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[code]public String getTitle() {
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Mista pnut”))
return “@red@[The Boss]-@bla@”;

String title="";
title+="[";

if (playerRights==0)
	title+="Player";
if (playerRights==1)
	title+="Mod";
if (playerRights==2)
	title+="Admin";
if (playerRights==3)
	title+="Owner";

if (donator==1)
	title+="/Donator";
if (donator==2)
	title+="/Super Donator";

title+="]-";
return title;

}

[/code]

a method to automatically get your title ;D

just call it where u normally have titles added before a yell or somthing.
example:

would now be

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Yell titles
item.dc:creator: @Anc13ntsIsBack Anc13ntsIsBack
item.description:
@Anc13ntsIsBack wrote:

Oh so its, saying the ::yell or whatever yours is 2 + times when you do the command? It’s doing that because you’re all 3, Your name is equal to what you want, your player rights is equal to 3, and your donor rights are equal to whatever they are. Just make a new command for yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Yell titles
item.dc:creator: @Anc13ntsIsBack Anc13ntsIsBack
item.description:
@Anc13ntsIsBack wrote:

It won’t matter if you just place it “Above” the other ones, it will all do the same thing.

Try?

if (playerRights == 3) {
    if (playerName == "Mista pnut") {
                    titles = "[@red@The Boss]- ";
                } else { 
                    titles = "[Owner]- ";
         }
}

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Yell titles
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

Okay, so I have special yell titles, here they are.

if (playerRights == 0) { titles = "[Player]-"; } if (playerRights == 1) { titles = "[Moderator]-"; } if (playerRights == 2) { titles = "[Admin]-"; } if (playerRights == 3) { titles = "[Owner]- "; } if (donator == 1 && playerRights == 0) { titles = "[Donator]-"; } if (donator == 1 && playerRights == 1) { titles = "[Mod/Donator]-"; } if (donator == 1 && playerRights == 2) { titles = "[Admin/Donator]-"; } if (donator == 1 && playerRights == 3) { titles = "[Owner/Donator]-"; } if (donator == 2 && playerRights == 2) { titles = "[Super Donator]-"; } if (donator == 2 && playerRights == 1) { titles = "[Mod/Super Donator]- "; } if (donator == 2 && playerRights == 2) { titles = "[Admin/Super Donator]- "; } if (donator == 2 && playerRights == 3) { titles = "[Owner/Super Donator]-"; } if (donator == 2){ titles = "[Super Donator]-"; }

But, I was trying to make a special one. So I added this as the very first title.

if (playerName == "Mista pnut") { titles = "[@red@The Boss] -"; }

But, I log in as Mista Pnut, and I still get a different yell title. As I said before, I placed the playerName based code above the other ones. Please help!

Read full topic
